Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    The Graph class acts as a container for the nodes that form the Risk map. It contains all functions used to gain access to nodes, but not necessarily all functions used to modify them.
    Author:
    Graham Netherton

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        public void addNode()
        Adds a new node to the graph.

      • addAdjacent

        public void addAdjacent(Node n1,
               Node n2)
        Adds a two-way adjacency link between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        n1 - The first node.
        n2 - The second node.

      • getNodeWithAdjacency

        public Node getNodeWithAdjacency(int adj,
                        int n)
        Attempts to find the nth node with the specified number of adjacent nodes.
        Parameters:
        adj - The number of required adjacent nodes.
        n - How many nodes in the process should look.
        Returns:
        The nth suitable node, or null if less than n were found.

      • getNumOwnedNodes

        public int getNumOwnedNodes(Player player)
        Counts the nodes owned by a given player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player making the request.
        Returns:
        The number of nodes owned by the player.

      • getOwnedNodes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Node> getOwnedNodes(Player player)
        Returns an ArrayList consisting of all the nodes owned by a given player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player making the request.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the nodes owned.

      • moveUnits

        public void moveUnits(Node from,
             Node to,
             int num)
        Moves units from one node to another.
        Parameters:
        from - The node to move the units from.
        to - The node to move the units to.
        num - The number of units to move.

      • placeUnit

        public boolean placeUnit(Node node,
                Player player)
        Places a unit in a node. Returns a boolean indicating if there was an error.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to place the unit at.
        player - The player placing the unit.
        Returns:
        True if there was an error, false if there wasn't.
